page.title: 12Village Shops - Post Office
page.content: Llandygwydd village shop and post office used to stock eerything the vilagers neeed. The shop now only stocks a few sweets but still operates as a sub-post office. Many people have cars and freezers, and consequently they drive to Cadigan to buy food at the supermarkets. Those who have not got a car go by bus to Cardigan or Walk to Llechryd where there is a general store. People who are old or unwell rely on mobile shops. People who are old or unwell rely on mobile hsops. A butcher comes twic weekly, the greengrocer comes eery Friday, the coal lorry calls and the milkman comes every two days. There is a shop and post office at Ponthirwaun. This shop has changed hands several times as people try to make it pay. It is now in the process of being sold again.
